info.description: API to create, update and manage exception value date for various entities distributors and fund.
info.title: Exception value date information

post.summary: Creates Exception value date for the specified parent
post.description: Creates Exception value date for the specified parent

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

get.summary: Retrieves a specific Exception value date record
get.description: Retrieves a specific Exception value date record

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Total number of records per page (Default:25)

parameters.name: orders
parameters.description: An 'orders' parameter allows you to specify the order in which rows appear in the result set Eg: orders=fundname:0,masterfund:1 where 'fundname' is field, '0' for ascending manner and ',' as seperator for fields

parameters.name: groups
parameters.description: A 'groups' parameter is used to collect data across multiple records and group the results by one or more columns. Eg: groups=nationality,reclaimtax-nationality:EQ:Indian,reclaimtax:EQ:N-nationality:COUNT where 'nationality,reclaimtax' is for the fields and 'nationality:EQ:Indian,reclaimtax:EQ:N-nationality' are filters, 'nationality:COUNT' is a aggregator and '-' as seperator

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Use a 'filters' parameter to select rows based on a value by using basic operators like EQ, NE etc.., Eg: filters=statistictype:NE:SRS where 'statistictype' is a field, 'NE' is a operator and 'SRS' is a value

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

reference.description: Contains external and internal identifiers of the record

entityType.description: Identifies the entity. For e.g. 0001 for registers, 0002 for agents, 0007 for investors, etc.

internalId.description: Internal identifier of the records.  Generated by the system during POST and can be used for other operations

promoterInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the entity

promoterExternalId.description: External identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the entity

parent.description: Contains external and internal identifiers of the parent record, if the current record belongs to sub entities

parentEntityType.description: Identifies the parent entity. For e.g. 0001 for registers, 0002 for agents, 0007 for investors, etc.

parentInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the parent record

parentExternalId.description: External identifier of the parent record

parentPromoterInternalId.description: Internal identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the parent entity

parentPromoterExternalId.description: External identifier of the Fund promoter linked to the parent entity

exceptionvaluedate.description: Contains individual attributes of the Exception value date entity

taFundId.description: Internal ID of the TA Fund for which the exception value date is applicable

taFundExternalId.description: External ID of the TA Fund for which the exception value date is applicable

shareClassCode.description: The shareclass code for which the value date exception is applicable. Allowed values are from the list of codes defined in MFGI.

operationCode.description: The operation code for which the value date exception is applicable. For example: 0001(Subscription), 0002(Redemption), 0006(Transfer), 0007(Switch)etc.  The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_COPER.

numberOfDays.description: It specifies the number of days between trade date and value date for the fund.

valueDateMethod.description: Value date method code to manage the settlement date based on the holidays to consider. For example: 0001 (Method1-Postpone Fund Country holiday), 0002 (Method2- Postpone Quotation/Payment currency holiday), 0003(Skip  Quotation/Payment currency holiday) etc.. The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_FDELAY.

condValueDateHolidayMasterFundCountry.description: It specifies the method  to calculate the value date if there is holiday in MF country. This field is mandatory if the Value date method is Method 5-Conditional value date calculation. Allowed values: 0001(postpone the value date if there is a holiday between trade date and value date). 0002(postpone the value date if it falls on a holiday), 0003(Not applicable). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_VALCND.

condValueDateHolidayPaymentCurrency.description: It specifies the method to calculate the value date if there is holiday in Payment Currency. This field is mandatory if the Value date method is Method 5-Conditional value date calculation. Allowed values 0001(postpone the value date if there is a holiday between trade date and value date). 0002(postpone the value date if it falls on a holiday), 0003(Not applicable). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_VALCND.

condValueDateHolidayQuotationCurrency.description: It specifies the method to calculate the value date if there is holiday in Quotation currency. This field is mandatory if the Value date method is Method 5-Conditional value date calculation. Allowed values 0001(postpone the value date if there is a holiday between trade date and value date). 0002(postpone the value date if it falls on a holiday), 0003(Not applicable). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_VALCND.

condValueDateHolidayReferenceCurrency.description: It specifies the method to calculate the value date if there is holiday in Reference currency. This field is mandatory if the Value date method is Method 5-Conditional value date calculation. Allowed values 0001(postpone the value date if there is a holiday between trade date and value date). 0002(postpone the value date if it falls on a holiday), 0003(Not applicable). The LoV is available in the CMESS table TA_VALCND.

condValueDateClosedWeekends.description: Flag allows to exclude week ends in the calculation of the value date. Allowed values: Y(for Yes), N(for No).
